intro: Fagara bombacifolia, commonly known as the Caribbean waxtree, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. Its bark contains a thick, waxy layer that gives it its common name. Fagara bombacifolia is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
